Cell.Data: Wait files ready to download timeout
Wait for publish to be completed
Wait because File is still being processed (virus scanned and stored)
Wait files to be downloaded timeout in seconds
From service start until logs show active timeout
Hello!! this is the test info
From LNE up until response OK timeout
From LNE up until response OK timeout

#!/bin/bash
logger -p auth.warning "included LLM Test message #1 auth.warning" logger -p auth.info "not included LLM Test message #X auth.info" logger -p auth.err "included LLM Test message #2 auth.err" logger -p auth.notice "not included LLM Test message #X auth.notice"
logger -p local0.debug "included LLM Test message #3 local.debug" logger -p local0.info "included LLM Test message #4 local.info" logger -p local0.notice "included LLM Test message #5 local.notice" logger -p local0.warning "included LLM Test message #6 local.warning" logger -p local0.err "included LLM Test message #7 local.err" logger -p local0.crit "included LLM Test message #8 local.crit" logger -p local0.alert "included LLM Test message #9 local.alert" logger -p local0.emerg "included LLM Test message #10 local.emerg"
logger -p authpriv.err "included LLM Test message #11 authpriv.err" logger -p cron.err "included LLM Test message #12 cron.err" logger -p daemon.err "included LLM Test message #13 daemon.err" logger -p ftp.err "included LLM Test message #14 ftp.err" logger -p lpr.err "included LLM Test message #15 lpr.err" logger -p mail.err "included LLM Test message #16 mail.err" logger -p news.err "included LLM Test message #17 news.err" logger -p syslog.err "included LLM Test message #18 syslog.err" logger -p user.err "included LLM Test message #19 user.err" logger -p uucp.err "included LLM Test message #20 uucp.err" logger -p local1.err "included LLM Test message #21 local1.err" logger -p local2.err "included LLM Test message #22 local2.err" logger -p local3.err "included LLM Test message #23 local3.err" logger -p local4.err "included LLM Test message #24 local4.err" logger -p local0.err "included LLM Test message #25 local0.err" logger -p local5.err "included LLM Test message #26 local5.err" logger -p local6.err "included LLM Test message #27 local6.err" logger -p local7.err "included LLM Test message #28 local7.err"
logger -p local1.debug "not included LLM Test message #X local1.debug" logger -p local2.info "not included LLM Test message #X local2.info" logger -p local3.notice "not included LLM Test message #X local3.notice" logger -p local4.warning "not included LLM Test message #X local4.warning" logger -p local5.crit "included LLM Test message #29 local5.crit" logger -p local6.alert "included LLM Test message #30 local6.alert"

logger -p auth.warning "included LLM Test message #1 auth.warning" logger -p auth.info "not included LLM Test message #X auth.info" logger -p auth.err "included LLM Test message #2 auth.err" logger -p auth.notice "not included LLM Test message #X auth.notice"

logger -p authpriv.err "included LLM Test message #11 authpriv.err" logger -p cron.err "included LLM Test message #12 cron.err" logger -p daemon.err "included LLM Test message #13 daemon.err" logger -p ftp.err "included LLM Test message #14 ftp.err" logger -p lpr.err "included LLM Test message #15 lpr.err" logger -p mail.err "included LLM Test message #16 mail.err" logger -p news.err "included LLM Test message #17 news.err" logger -p syslog.err "included LLM Test message #18 syslog.err" logger -p user.err "included LLM Test message #19 user.err" logger -p uucp.err "included LLM Test message #20 uucp.err" logger -p local1.err "included LLM Test message #21 local1.err" logger -p local2.err "included LLM Test message #22 local2.err" logger -p local3.err "included LLM Test message #23 local3.err" logger -p local4.err "included LLM Test message #24 local4.err" logger -p local0.err "included LLM Test message #25 local0.err" logger -p local5.err "included LLM Test message #26 local5.err" logger -p local6.err "included LLM Test message #27 local6.err" logger -p local7.err "included LLM Test message #28 local7.err"

REM delete folders and create them again with files+content to make the test pre-requisites del /F /Q c:\test_files\ 2>nul del /F /Q c:\test_files2\ 2>nul RD /S /Q c:\test_files\ 2>nul RD /S /Q c:\test_files2\ 2>nul if not exist "C:\test_files\" mkdir C:\test_files if not exist "C:\test_files2\" mkdir C:\test_files2
REM this log record shouldn't be collected (even tho it matches the filter) since monitor on the folder is configured to only collect new reords echo test_file.log not included nep file test line 0 > c:\test_files\test_file.log REM this log record should be collected since monitor on the folder is NOT configured to collect only new records echo test_file.txt included nep test 0 > c:\test_files2\test_file.txt

REM add log recordss to the txt file (all should be collected since no filter is configured on this monitor echo test_file.txt included nep test 1 >> c:\test_files2\test_file.txt echo test_file.txt included nep test 2 >> c:\test_files2\test_file.txt
REM add log records to an exiting log file - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter echo test_file.log included nep test 1 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log echo test_file.log included line file 2 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log echo tet_file.log not included nep file 3 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log echo test_fil.log not included test line 4 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log
REM create a new log file and add records to it - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter type NUL > c:\test_files\test_file2.log timeout /t 7 /nobreak echo test_file2.log included nep test 0 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo test_file2.log included line file 1 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo tet_file2.log not included nep file 2 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo test_fil2.log not included test line 3 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log

#!/bin/bash #delete folders and create them again with files+content to make the test pre-requisites rm -rf /root/test_files rm -rf /root/test_files2 mkdir -p /root/test_files mkdir -p /root/test_files2
#this log record shouldn't be collected (even tho it matches the filter) since monitor on the folder is configured to only collect new reords echo "test_file.log not included nep file test line 0" > /root/test_files/test_file.log #this log record should be collected since monitor on the folder is NOT configured to collect only new records echo "test_file.txt included nep test 0" > /root/test_files2/test_file.txt

#!/bin/bash #add log recordss to the txt file (all should be collected since no filter is configured on this monitor echo "test_file.txt included nep test 1" >> /root/test_files2/test_file.txt echo "test_file.txt included nep test 2" >> /root/test_files2/test_file.txt #add log records to an exiting log file - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter echo "test_file.log included nep test 1" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log echo "test_file.log included line file 2" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log echo "tet_file.log not included nep file 3" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log echo "test_fil.log not included test line 4" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log #create a new log file and add records to it - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter > /root/test_files/test_file2.log sleep 7 echo "test_file2.log included nep test 0" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log echo "test_file2.log included line file 1" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log echo "tet_file2.log not included nep file 2" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log echo "test_fil2.log not included test line 3" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log

REM delete folders and create them again with files+content to make the test pre-requisites del /F /Q c:\test_files\ 2>nul del /F /Q c:\test_files2\ 2>nul RD /S /Q c:\test_files\ 2>nul RD /S /Q c:\test_files2\ 2>nul if not exist "C:\test_files\" mkdir C:\test_files if not exist "C:\test_files2\" mkdir C:\test_files2
REM this log record shouldn't be collected (even tho it matches the filter) since monitor on the folder is configured to only collect new reords echo test_file.log not included nep file test line 0 > c:\test_files\test_file.log REM this log record should be collected since monitor on the folder is NOT configured to collect only new records echo test_file.txt included nep test 0 > c:\test_files2\test_file.txt

REM add log recordss to the txt file (all should be collected since no filter is configured on this monitor echo test_file.txt included nep test 1 >> c:\test_files2\test_file.txt echo test_file.txt included nep test 2 >> c:\test_files2\test_file.txt
REM add log records to an exiting log file - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter echo test_file.log included nep test 1 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log echo test_file.log included line file 2 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log echo tet_file.log not included nep file 3 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log echo test_fil.log not included test line 4 >> c:\test_files\test_file.log
REM create a new log file and add records to it - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter type NUL > c:\test_files\test_file2.log timeout /t 7 /nobreak echo test_file2.log included nep test 0 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo test_file2.log included line file 1 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo tet_file2.log not included nep file 2 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo test_fil2.log not included test line 3 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log

#!/bin/bash #delete folders and create them again with files+content to make the test pre-requisites rm -rf /root/test_files rm -rf /root/test_files2 mkdir -p /root/test_files mkdir -p /root/test_files2
#this log record shouldn't be collected (even tho it matches the filter) since monitor on the folder is configured to only collect new reords echo "test_file.log not included nep file test line 0" > /root/test_files/test_file.log #this log record should be collected since monitor on the folder is NOT configured to collect only new records echo "test_file.txt included nep test 0" > /root/test_files2/test_file.txt

#!/bin/bash #add log recordss to the txt file (all should be collected since no filter is configured on this monitor echo "test_file.txt included nep test 1" >> /root/test_files2/test_file.txt echo "test_file.txt included nep test 2" >> /root/test_files2/test_file.txt #add log records to an exiting log file - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter echo "test_file.log included nep test 1" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log echo "test_file.log included line file 2" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log echo "tet_file.log not included nep file 3" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log echo "test_fil.log not included test line 4" >> /root/test_files/test_file.log #create a new log file and add records to it - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter > /root/test_files/test_file2.log sleep 7 echo "test_file2.log included nep test 0" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log echo "test_file2.log included line file 1" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log echo "tet_file2.log not included nep file 2" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log echo "test_fil2.log not included test line 3" >> /root/test_files/test_file2.log

ECHO "Creating win defender logs" ::# *[System[(Level=1 or Level=2 or Level=3 or Level=4 or Level=0 or Level=5) and ( (EventID >= 111 and EventID <= 555) )]] eventcreate /Id 111 /D "WLM test log included - win defender info" /T information /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender" eventcreate /Id 555 /D "WLM test log included - win defender error" /T error /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender" eventcreate /Id 110 /D "WLM test log excluded - win defender info" /T information /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender" eventcreate /Id 556 /D "WLM test log excluded - win defender error" /T error /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender"
ECHO "Creating application logs" ::# EventID, values=111, 222, 333, 444, 555 Provider, values=wlm_test_source eventcreate /Id 111 /D "WLM test log included - application error" /T error /L "application" /so wlm_test_source eventcreate /Id 333 /D "WLM test log included - application warning" /T warning /L "application" /so wlm_test_source eventcreate /Id 110 /D "WLM test log excluded - application error" /T error /L "application" /so wlm_test_source eventcreate /Id 111 /D "WLM test log excluded - application error" /T error /L "application" /so wlm_test_source2
ECHO "Creating system logs" ::# EventID, values=111 eventcreate /Id 111 /D "WLM test log included - system information" /T information /L "system" /so TestSource1 eventcreate /Id 111 /D "WLM test log included - system information" /T information /L "system" /so TestSource2 eventcreate /Id 111 /D "WLM test log excluded - system error" /T error /L "system" /so TestSource2 eventcreate /Id 333 /D "WLM test log excluded - system information" /T information /L "system" /so TestSource1
ECHO "Creating setup logs" ::# *[System[Provider[@Name='WlmTestSource'] and (Level=2)]] eventcreate /Id 999 /D "WLM test log included - setup error" /T error /L "setup" /so SetupTestSource eventcreate /Id 1000 /D "WLM test log included - setup error" /T error /L "setup" /so SetupTestSource eventcreate /Id 999 /D "WLM test log excluded - setup warning" /T warning /L "setup" /so SetupTestSource eventcreate /Id 123 /D "WLM test log excluded - setup error" /T error /L "setup" /so SetupTestSource1
From EP service start until logs show EP active timeout

REM create a new log file and add records to it - only the first two should be collected since they match the monitor filter type NUL > c:\test_files\test_file2.log timeout /t 7 /nobreak echo test_file2.log included nep test 0 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo test_file2.log included line file 1 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo tet_file2.log not included nep file 2 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log echo test_fil2.log not included test line 3 >> c:\test_files\test_file2.log

ECHO "Creating win defender logs" ::# *[System[(Level=1 or Level=2 or Level=3 or Level=4 or Level=0 or Level=5) and ( (EventID >= 111 and EventID <= 555) )]] eventcreate /Id 111 /D "WLM test log included - win defender info" /T information /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender" eventcreate /Id 555 /D "WLM test log included - win defender error" /T error /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender" eventcreate /Id 110 /D "WLM test log excluded - win defender info" /T information /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender" eventcreate /Id 556 /D "WLM test log excluded - win defender error" /T error /L "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender/Operational" /so "Windows Defender"
